bug.short_desc: Camino 2.1a2pre and 2.1a1 topcrash reports haven't been generated for several days

reporter.name: Smokey Ardisson (offline for a while; no bugmail - do not email)

assigned_to.name: Nobody; OK to take it and work on it

who.name: Smokey Ardisson (offline for a while; no bugmail - do not email)

long_desc.thetext:
The Camino 2.1a2pre topcrash report hasn't been updated* since 02-Apr, despite it not expiring until 17-Apr in Branch Data Sources. In addition, the report for 2.1a1 hasn't been updated since 03-Apr.
Other active reports (2.0.6/2.0.7) seem to be being updated OK (2.0.7pre/2.0.8pre don't have any results, which is to be expected, since we prompt these users to upgrade to 2.1a1).
* By which I mean the info text at the top of the report today (06-Apr) reads: "Top 4 Crashing Signatures. 2011-03-19 07:00:00 through 2011-04-02 07:00:00. The report covers 100.00% of all 4 crashes during this period." Normally, for active reports, the date range is updated each day; for reports that have expired, the date range freezes to the relevant dates on the report's expiration day.
This is a problem since 2.1a1/2.1a2pre are our active milestone/development nightlies, and we can't tell what's happening wrt crashes.
